body:
I personally don't mind the status quo - even though gofmt enforces quite a bit, there are still significant areas of style freedom, and I think it's fine if some tools choose something different within that space when generating new code.

FWIW we use a slightly different style - imports are sorted into three sections: stdlib, external and repo-local. I have a separate tool (github.com/rogpeppe/sortimports) that enforces that opinion. I don't think it matters at all whether other projects use that style, but it's useful for us to be consistent. If there was general agreement that that style was in fact a Good Thing, then perhaps it might be considered for inclusion in goimports, I guess.
